formatDescription: A Geopackage is designed for transferring geospatial information in a platform-independent, portable, open and standards based way. It is a standard describing a set of conventions for storing vector features, extensions and tile matrix sets of imagery and raster maps at various scales within a SQLite database. It was defined and published by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) in 2014.
provenanceCompoundName: The National Archives of the Czech Republic / The National Archives of the Czech Republic

internalSignatures.name: OGC GeoPackage
internalSignatures.note: BOF Absolute from beginning of file, magic bytes: SQLite format 3{53}GP*gpkg_spatial_ref_sys
